subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






April 10, 2007


                              		
                              		
                              	  Home | U.S. | World | Politics | SciTech | Health | Entertainment | Business | Opinion | Sports | Blogs | Interactives | Video

TOP STORIESFemale Bomber Kills 16 Iraqi Recruits
A female suicide bomber walked into a large crowd of hopeful Iraqi police recruits and blew herself up, killing at least 16
                        people. A separate blast killed at least six people in Baghdad. Also, four more American troop deaths have been announced. More...Watch: Iraqis Protest U.S. Presence
• CBS, MSNBC Suspend Don Imus For 2 Weeks
                     					| Watch• Another Suspension In Student Loan Probe• N. Korea Reactor Deadline Ticks CloserU.S.Dallas DA Admits Mistaken Rape Arrest
James Curtis Giles spent 10 years in prison for a gang rape he has long said he did not commit. On Monday, more than a decade
                        after his release, a prosecutor acknowledged Giles' arrest had been a case of mistaken identity. More...
• Another Suspension In Student Loan Probe• CBS, MSNBC Suspend Don Imus For 2 Weeks
                     					| Watch• Olympic Sprinter Guilty In Fraud Scheme• More StoriesWorldN. Korea Reactor Deadline Ticks Closer
A U.S. official has warned North Korea that time is running out to shut down their nuclear reactor ahead of a Saturday deadline,
                        but with a bank set to free up $25 million in frozen funds demanded by Pyongyang, it may not be too late yet. More...
• Female Bomber Kills 16 Iraqi Recruits
                     					| Watch• U.S. Files New Piracy Cases Against China
                     					| Watch• Border Patrol Agents Under Attack
                     					| Watch• More StoriesPoliticsBush Renews Push For Immigration Reform
President Bush, on a visit to the U.S.-Mexico border, touted progress in deterring illegal crossings and pressed Congress
                        to pass legislation with a guest worker provision.  More...Watch: The Cost Of Immigration
• Pure Horserace: An Age-Old Question
                     					| Watch• New York Moves Primary Date To Feb. 5
                     					| Watch• McCain Discusses Iraq Market Visit
                     					| Watch• More StoriesHealthHerb May Cure Bladder Infections
Lab tests on mice show that Forskolin, an herbal medicine made from the Asiatic coleus plant, may help treat urinary tract
                        infection, researchers say. More...
• New Device May Heal Damaged Hearts
                     					| Watch• Is Breast Cancer Worse For Hispanic Women?• Doctors' Spiritual Beliefs May Impact Care• More StoriesSciTechCompetition For TiVo
All personal video recorder systems are not created equal, says CBS News Technology Analyst Larry Magid, who reports
                        on the pros and cons of the Dish Network PVR ViP622. More...
• Love In The Age Of Google• Space Capsule Carrying U.S. Mogul Docks
                     					| Watch• Researcher Records His Life On Computer
                     					| Watch• More StoriesBusinessU.S. Files New Piracy Cases Against China
The Bush administration is filing two new trade cases against China over copyright piracy and restrictions on the sale of
                        American movies, music and books. It is America's latest response to the growing pressure to fix soaring trade deficits. More...Watch: Battling Movie Piracy In China
• Dumping Internet Service May Cost You• What To Do If You Can't Pay Your Taxes• Companies Heeding Gripes About Long Lines
                     					| Watch• More StoriesEntertainmentCBS, MSNBC Suspend Don Imus For 2 Weeks
CBS Radio and MSNBC both said Monday they were suspending Don Imus' morning talk show for two weeks as a protest grew
                        about his reference last week to members of the Rutgers women's basketball team as "nappy-headed hos." More...Watch: Imus On The Hot Seat
• Maguire: "I Have An Addictive Nature"
                     					| Watch• "B.C." Cartoonist Johnny Hart Dies At 76• Kidman And Urban Go Back Down Under• More StoriesOpinionThe Gutting Of The Justice Department
CBSNews.com legal analyst Andrew Cohen says the firing of eight U.S. attorneys might have been a shock to the country,
                        but its reverberations are just beginning. Already flaws beyond the surface of the Justice Department are showing.
                         More...
• Statecraft Requires Reality Check
                     					| Watch• The Emotional Roller Coaster Of Combat
                     					| Watch• Andy: Let's Have A Queen
                     					| Watch• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSShowBuzz: People Late & Great: Anna Nicole's Half-Sister Speaks
Donna Hogan will sit down with The Early Show's Hannah Storm on Tuesday and Wednesday in what will be her first
                        interview since Smith died of an accidental overdose on Feb. 8.
                         More...Watch: Birkhead Awaits DNA Results
